page.title: 18ORTON - 50 YEARS AGO
page.content: Orton 50 years ago was quite different from what it is now.There were six shops which sold sweets and groceries.In those days people rode bicycles but few people had cars.Orton did not have any holiday cottages and the Market Hall was used as a Dance Hall.The vicar for Orton was Canon King and the school head master was Mr Beal.There were about 300 people living in Orton then.Those who had holidays went to Morecambe.There were two pubs_The Duke of Cumberland and the George Hotel.Peoples jobs were joiners, blacksmiths, cobblers, farmers and iron mongers.Buses ran to Kendal and Penrith.There were two doctors_Dr Graham and Dr Gibson.About the mid-1930's the local "Pot Fair", held at Whitsuntide, and the "Tup Fair",held on 21st October on the School Green, both came to an end.
